chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: Dead flies cause the ointment of the apothecary to send forth a stinking savour: so doth a little folly him that is in reputation for wisdom and honour.
items.plainText: Dead flies cause the ointment of the apothecary to send forth a stinking savour: so doth a little folly him that is in reputation for wisdom and honour.

items.text: A wise man's heart is at his right hand; but a fool's heart at his left.
items.plainText: A wise man's heart is at his right hand; but a fool's heart at his left.

items.text: Yea also, when he that is a fool walketh by the way, his wisdom faileth him, and he saith to every one that he is a fool.
items.plainText: Yea also, when he that is a fool walketh by the way, his wisdom faileth him, and he saith to every one that he is a fool.

items.text: If the spirit of the ruler rise up against thee, leave not thy place; for yielding pacifieth great offences.
items.plainText: If the spirit of the ruler rise up against thee, leave not thy place; for yielding pacifieth great offences.

items.text: There is an evil which I have seen under the sun, as an error which proceedeth from the ruler:
items.plainText: There is an evil which I have seen under the sun, as an error which proceedeth from the ruler:

items.text: Folly is set in great dignity, and the rich sit in low place.
items.plainText: Folly is set in great dignity, and the rich sit in low place.

items.text: I have seen servants upon horses, and princes walking as servants upon the earth.
items.plainText: I have seen servants upon horses, and princes walking as servants upon the earth.

items.text: He that diggeth a pit shall fall into it; and whoso breaketh an hedge, a serpent shall bite him.
items.plainText: He that diggeth a pit shall fall into it; and whoso breaketh an hedge, a serpent shall bite him.

items.text: Whoso removeth stones shall be hurt therewith; and he that cleaveth wood shall be endangered thereby.
items.plainText: Whoso removeth stones shall be hurt therewith; and he that cleaveth wood shall be endangered thereby.

items.text: If the iron be blunt, and he do not whet the edge, then must he put to more strength: but wisdom is profitable to direct.
items.plainText: If the iron be blunt, and he do not whet the edge, then must he put to more strength: but wisdom is profitable to direct.

items.text: Surely the serpent will bite without enchantment; and a babbler is no better.
items.plainText: Surely the serpent will bite without enchantment; and a babbler is no better.

items.text: The words of a wise man's mouth are gracious; but the lips of a fool will swallow up himself.
items.plainText: The words of a wise man's mouth are gracious; but the lips of a fool will swallow up himself.

items.text: The beginning of the words of his mouth is foolishness: and the end of his talk is mischievous madness.
items.plainText: The beginning of the words of his mouth is foolishness: and the end of his talk is mischievous madness.

items.text: A fool also is full of words: a man cannot tell what shall be; and what shall be after him, who can tell him?
items.plainText: A fool also is full of words: a man cannot tell what shall be; and what shall be after him, who can tell him?

items.text: The labour of the foolish wearieth every one of them, because he knoweth not how to go to the city.
items.plainText: The labour of the foolish wearieth every one of them, because he knoweth not how to go to the city.

items.text: Woe to thee, O land, when thy king is a child, and thy princes eat in the morning!
items.plainText: Woe to thee, O land, when thy king is a child, and thy princes eat in the morning!

items.text: Blessed art thou, O land, when thy king is the son of nobles, and thy princes eat in due season, for strength, and not for drunkenness!
items.plainText: Blessed art thou, O land, when thy king is the son of nobles, and thy princes eat in due season, for strength, and not for drunkenness!

items.text: By much slothfulness the building decayeth; and through idleness of the hands the house droppeth through.
items.plainText: By much slothfulness the building decayeth; and through idleness of the hands the house droppeth through.

items.text: A feast is made for laughter, and wine maketh merry: but money answereth all things.
items.plainText: A feast is made for laughter, and wine maketh merry: but money answereth all things.

items.text: Curse not the king, no not in thy thought; and curse not the rich in thy bedchamber: for a bird of the air shall carry the voice, and that which hath wings shall tell the matter.
items.plainText: Curse not the king, no not in thy thought; and curse not the rich in thy bedchamber: for a bird of the air shall carry the voice, and that which hath wings shall tell the matter.
